title: ***DARRVIN CREST E-BIKE 29R***
text: E+ MTB Hardtail | Urban, Commuting, Touring, MountainSeamless integration upgrade - choose from four configurations.Simple | Sport | City | Touring.OPTIONAL EXTRA: Darrvin Clip on Fender Set, Darrvin Pannier Rack, Darrvin Trunk Bag, Side Stand, Kenda Kwick Journey Commuter Tyre 700x40c.Upgrades include an updated frame geometry with a fully integrated battery, tapered headset, adjustable air suspension fork and wider gear range. Our most versatile model yet.WARRANTY: 1 Year Motor and Battery, 5 Years FrameAVAILABILITY: South Africa (As of August 2021)MODEL YEAR: 2022FEATURESConfidence inspiring MTB frame geometry with 29’’ wheels to smooth the trail.Powerful and responsive Bafang 350W mid motor with ISIS Drive axle for added strength.Front Suspension fork with a remote lock-out.Ultra reliable BAFANG 1 x 9 drive-train with a wide gear range .Aggressive tyres fitted to extra wide rims invite you to get rowdy. With a wider bar and sport orientated components the CREST packs more options than a Swiss army knife. GENERAL NOTES ON RANGE: Predicting range depends on a number of factors: eg. someone who weighs about 70Kg, riding across varied terrain with moderate undulation and a steady cadence of 70-80 rpm can control the range through battery management using the mode settings afforded by the control system. He/She could expect to get anything between 80-120Km from a single battery charge. Visit our FAQ Page for more general Q&A’s.SPECSFRAME: DARRVIN EVO Lite Alloy 29erFRONT FORK: MOZO Mag 29er Air Lock-Out 100mmCHAIN WHEEL: Bafang D-Tech 36T	CHAIN: KMC X9 E Optimised	PEDALS: Wellgo MTB GripHEADSET: D-Tech Sealed Taper Semi IntegratedHANDLEBAR: Promax Comfort Rise 700mmHANDLEBAR STEM: Promax 60/75mm alloy		GRIP/TAPE: Darrvin Trail Touch	BRAKE SET: Darrvin Apex Hydraulic 160mmHUB SET: Darrvin Forged Alloy 32h	RIM: D-Tech Double Wall 29erSPOKE: Stainless Steel black		TIRE: Kenda Slant Six 29 x 2.25	REAR DERAILLEUR: Shimano Altus M2000 SGS 9 Speed	DERAILLEUR LEVER SET R/H: Shimano SLM 2010 Rapid Fire Plus		GEARS: Shimano HG201 11-36T 9 Speed		SADDLE: Darrvin Comfort Sport		SEAT POST: Promax Micro AdjustSEAT CLAMP: D-Tech Quick ReleaseOPTIONAL EXTRA: Darrvin Clip on Fender Set, Darrvin Pannier Rack, Darrvin Trunk Bag, Side Stand, Kenda Kwick Journey Commuter Tyre 700x40c.NOTES ON WEIGHT: A really lightweight mid-range e-bike weighs in at around 21-23Kg, provided its a standard 250watt mid-drive motor model with 300-500Wh battery. A super light carbon MTB e-bike with roughly the same motor and battery might come in at 18-20Kg. For instance a top end R 150 000 ($10 000 USD) Specialized e-bike weighs just over 20Kg. The weight is a consideration if you need to transport the bike on a rack or in the back of your vehicle, but removing the battery might save 4-5Kg already when attempting to lift the bike. Either way, at the moment there is not really a significant difference in weight between most of the available e-bikes in the market. Darrvin’s lightweight aluminum-alloy frame and compact components make for one of the lighter e-bike configurations out there in its price class and with the battery removed is an easy lift onto any bike rack.Mechanical Guarantee: All components will be in a very reasonable to new condition on pre-owned bikes. title: Specialized Stumpjumper FSR Expert Carbon 29
text: Selling my size medium 2016 Specialized Stumpjumper FSR Expert Carbon 29 trail bike. In great condition and well looked after. The bike has 150mm front suspension and 130mm rear suspension.The fork has just had a full service done at the end of June, the rear shock has also been recently serviced. A brand new cassette, chain and chainring have just been fitted and never used. The headset bearings were replaced at the same time as the fork service and the rest of the bearings have also been replaced recently. The brakes have also had a full service recently. Front and rear tyres are still in very good condition.The bike came with Dt Swiss hubs which I upgraded to Lyne Components hubs, a JB01 front hub and a JB03 rear hub. The JB03 hub is Lyne Components high engagement hub which sounds and works great.Reason for selling is that I would like to move to an enduro/long travel bike.FrameSpecialized Stumpjumper FSR Expert Carbon 29ForkRockShox Pike RC 29, 150mm Travel.Rear ShockFox Float CTD Factory Series with Kashima Coating, 130mm Travel.Rear DerailleurSram X1 11 SpeedShiftersSram X1 11 Speed.CranksetCSixx TT 32T Chainring and Sram 175mm Cranks.CassetteSram GX 11 Speed.ChainSram X1 11 Speed.BrakesShimano XT.WheelsLyne Components Aluminum 32 hole (front), Specialized Traverse 28 hole (rear).TyresMaxxis Assegai 2.5 (Front), Maxxis DHR 2 2.4 (Rear).StemLyne Components 50mmHandlebarSpecialized 760mm with ODI Rogue Lock-On Grips.SeatpostSpecialized Command Dropper Post 125mmSaddleRyder Swift 2.0

title: 2017 Giant Anthem 2 Mountain Bike
text:
2017, Giant Anthem 2, a nimble ride that's a blast to weave through tricky lines or whip around turns


The Anthem 2 is a fun and flickable 110mm, 27.5-inch offering from Giant. This nimble steed rips through corners and hunts down every site hit. It bunny hops and manuals at will and speedy acceleration adds to the fun. These antics combine with solid downhill and superior climbing performance to make for a solid, straightforward trail option. A few testers experience a suspiciously high number of pedal strikes aboard this bike. Other notable drawbacks are a less than ideal tire and rim width and an outdated cockpit setup with a long stem and narrower bars. Still, this bike is outfitted with an impressive value to performance ratio thanks to its spectacular build kit. The Giant sports Fox suspension, a Shimano SLX 1x11 drivetrain, Shimano Deore M615 brakes and a Giant Contact SL Switch dropper post. 
The Anthem is a fantastic option if you're more comfortable with smaller wheels and prefer a quick, responsive ride. This bike is well-equipped out of the box, is capable on a wide variety of terrain, and excels in tighter, more technical trails.

text: Kindly read the entire description and view all the pictures before making contact. Swipe from one picture to the next, tap on picture for full view and pinch-zoom for greater detail.Unit pictured is the exact one that you're getting. Nothing more, nothing less. If it's not in the pictures, it's not there.Take your time to check through the pictures. I've tried to represent the product as honestly and completely as possible. I do my best to be your eyes when taking the pictures.Item used and will need some TLC to get mobile, but if you're handy with these things it shouldn't cost you too much before you're heading for the hills.Don't buy if you don't know what it is or can do! title: Large Giant Revel 29er 1x10
text: I am very reluctant to sell this bike. I bought this bike with my first salary in 2018. I've put a lot of time, money, effort and sweat into this bike. It's brought me a lot of good times. This bike has never been for a full service so if you can afford it definitely take it for a good check-up. I've done most of the work myself. Only service it's had was brake bleeding and replacing an old rear wheel bearing. The rest was all me. This bike has a lot of personality a.k.a dings and scratches, so don't expect a new bike. I'm selling this bike because I feel like I've reached a point were I want to try something new. Would like to start a new hobby, hopefully the funds from this sale will help me achieve that. Upgrades:Maxxis 2.35 IKON tyres, these are great tyres with a lot of rubber left. Nice and thick. Recently replaced the rim tape with Gorilla tape. Wheels might need slime (I have a bottle). Also had the valves replaced recently. ( I have a decent stand up pump with gage)New grips, some hate them, I like them. I have extra kit for grips too. I have gloves too"new" Second hand pedals. Old ones were stripped, these work fine. Can adjust cleat tightness easily. I have size 9/10 shoes if you want them.Tektro hydraulic brakes with brand new pads, they've probably been used twice, might need to run them in a bit more before they are working as they should. Brakes were recently serviced and bleed.Bottom bracket was replaced with a new SHIMANO one, no squeaking.1x10 groupset - SRAM 36T front - SHIMANO XT 10 speed rear. Gears shift fine, sometimes a little temperamental on changing gears while climbing a hill, but works fine. I'll give you my chain lube.Rock Shox Reverb Dropper. I took this off when I was doing a lot of road cycling, tried to save some weight. It's bit heavy, cable is tough to manage, but works fine. Helps A LOT with descending especially with this hard tail. You need to extra leverage. This dropper also functions as a small shock absorber for your lower back, pretty cool.New shorter stem I have the old GIANT stem if you want it.Small pouch clips into bracket under seat. I have 2 CO2 bomb valves, multitools and a lot more you can have.As I've said, I'm reluctant to sell my bike, so please be respectful of the price. We can negotiate when you come take a look at this shiny turd. Thanks
